Let me first make an observation and then a suggestion that I think would deal with the valid concerns about selling weapons at gun shows without back ground checks. First of all, I have been to shows and was impressed by how many types, numbers of guns, and varieties of guns these sellers had for sale in their respective booths. I also know that for the cost of renting the space for a booth at these shows, a guy with only 5 guns to sell will never pay for the space to sell them there. So the sellers at these shows are more than just private sellers, that is somewhat of a legal loophole to make that claim. They truly appeared to me to be much more than just private sellers. 
 
 With that said, and considering the day and age we find ourselves in with terrorism, I would suggest 2 classes of private type sellers out there. One would be guys like me who might want to sell one or two guns every few years or whenever he does. For him, because he's unable to affectively do a background check, all that's required is that he do the necessary paperwork to make sure that the registration for the weapon he's selling is properly and legally transfered from himself to the buyer who supplied to valid forms of ID with a photo attached. 
 
 As for the gun show sellers, they can only qualify to rent a booth if they have a license to collect and sell weapons, and must be hooked up to the ATF criminal check system so IDs can be checked on the spot so back ground checks can be done with no inconvenience to the seller or the buyer. If that isn't possible, then the local police station should make a phone bank available to do criminal checks as the sellers call in with a predetermined code verifying who they are. The buyers SS#, License# and DOB should be all that's needed to confirm identity which the seller will compare to the pictured ID the buyer provides.
 
 Prior to 9/11/01 I would have been staunchly against everything I'm saying here and would have argued for deregulation and no government intervention at all. But times have changed and so must our willingness to allow minimum scrutiny so as to prevent real criminals or non citizens from being allowed to purchase weapons.
